forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5pm, then rain showers. Cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 23 to 36 mph, with gusts as high as 54 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers before 8pm, then showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy. Low around 45, with temperatures rising to around 47 overnight. West southwest wind 14 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the day unfolds under a thick quilt of overcast skies, where the drama of rain paints a rather gray tableau. As the afternoon progresses, dark clouds weave themselves into a cloak of moisture, heralding a 100% chance of rain. The brisk south-southwest wind howls through the streets, creating a cacophony of whispers while rustling the trees and rattling umbrellas. In this damp embrace, temperatures linger around the upper 50s, gradually yielding to cooler air as the day wears on. 

As evening descends, expect a symphony of rain showers coupled with the occasional thunderclap, evoking a sense of cozy introspection indoors. Tonight, with the thermometer dipping to the mid-40s, the scenery may be dreary, but it offers a chance for reflective moments, perhaps best enjoyed from a comfortably warm café window with a good book or over shared stories with friends. Dress in layers—warm socks, a sturdy coat, and a resilient umbrella will be your allies against the elements. The fog hangs low, wrapping the city in a gentle veil, quietly reminding you of the ever-present beauty even in moments of shadow.
